entry.title: Greek Foreign Minister announces aid for those forcibly displaced from Karabakh

media:group.media:title: Greek Foreign Minister announces aid for those forcibly displaced from Karabakh
media:group.media:description:
üìçIn Yerevan, Greek Foreign Minister conveys support for Armenia‚Äôs EU aspirations, a UNESCO fact finding mission for Christian sites in Nagorno-Karabakh, and promises aid to its displaced population. üìçThe World Bank expects Armenia's GDP to grow by 4.7% in 2024, and estimates it grew 7.1% in 2023. üìçBarrier placed by developer of Cow‚Äôs Garden property removes barrier after pressure from local activists, and also removes the last bulldozer on site. üìçNew footage of Armenia‚Äôs iconic bezoar goats at this link: https://www.facebook.com/CivilNet.TV/videos/342250355339830

entry.title: CivilNet Wins Court Case Against Government on Mining Inspections

media:group.media:title: CivilNet Wins Court Case Against Government on Mining Inspections
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenia has responded to Azerbaijan's latest proposals related to a peace agreement, while US State Department Advisor Louis Bono pays a visit to Armenia to discuss the process. üìçPope Francis urges the signing of a peace treaty between Armenia and Azerbaijan and for the refugees‚Äô right to return in his annual ‚ÄúState of the World‚Äù address. üìçCivilNet wins a court case which obligates the government's department of Environmental Protection and Subsoil Inspection to release details on its mining inspections and the violations found. üìçOur latest episode of Mindful Leaders is with scientist, data researcher, and angel investor Dr. Armen Kherlopian. He talks AI, startups, and the inspiration he draws from his family roots from Cilicia. Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j6kQD8148TQ üìçAlso, celebrating Sergei Parajanov‚Äôs 100th birthday.

entry.title: We need to protect small companies that can change the face of nations

media:group.media:title: We need to protect small companies that can change the face of nations
media:group.media:description:
In this episode, we explore the life of Armen Kherlopian, Ph.D., a scientist, researcher, angel investor, and advisor to the board of several prominent corporations. We discuss the relevance of artificial intelligence, data sciences, and innovations for tomorrow. With a background in biomedical engineering and biophysics, we assess how Dr. Kherlopian entered the world of entrepreneurship, investments, and startups and how he makes sense of a world increasingly dependent on machine learning. Finally, we explore Dr. Kherlopian‚Äôs historical and family legacies from Aintab and Marash, which have been pivotal in his successes and mission to push boundaries in tech and sciences and contribute to the betterment of our world.
About Armen R. Kherlopian
Armen Kherlopian is CEO and Partner at Covenant Venture Capital. He is also a Founding Partner of the BAJ Accelerator, hosted at the Jacobs Technion-Cornell Institute. He serves on the Scientific Advisory Board of the Translational Research Institute for Space Health (TRISH), as well as on the board directors at Scylla. He is also an advisor to Cognaize and Embodied. Previously, Kherlopian served as Chief Science Officer at Genpact, and during his work at Booz Allen Hamilton, he co-wrote the coveted Field Guide to Data Science. Kherlopian is an awardee of the U.S. National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellowship, U.S. Department of Energy Computational Science Graduate Fellowship, is a Coca-Cola Scholar and a U.S. Delegate to the Lindau Nobel Laureates Meetings. He holds a BS and MS in Biomedical Engineering with a focus on Algorithms from Columbia University and a PhD in Biophysics with a focus on Machine Learning from Cornell University. He also completed a fellowship in High Performance Computing and Artificial Intelligence at Princeton University.
Program Overview Mindful Leaders dives into the stories of people who have achieved prominence, walked incredible journeys, and have defined culture.
Lara sits down with specialists, thinkers, and change catalysts to deconstruct insights, events, and lessons that have shaped their personal and professional lives and have enabled them to create meaning and connection.
00:00 - Intro 1:54 - Who is Armen Kherlopian? 3:09 - Merging science with entrepreneurship and investments 5:01 - Machine learning and AI projects that made great impacts 8:50 - Benefits of AI and machine learning 12:54 -The importance of dreams and efforts today 15:19 - How to address apathy and individualism 17:34 - Childhood and the role of parents 21:11 - Grandparents and lessons from historical legacy 24:29 - Analogy and lessons of innovation between historical Armenians and Armenians today 29:41 - BAJ Accelerator 31:52 - What is required to invest in innovative projects 32:51 - What type of leadership is required to help heal nations? 34:18 - Conclusion

media:group.media:description:
üìçPashinyan‚Äôs trip to renovated schools go viral as he uncovers numerous deficiencies, leading to the sacking of regional governors. üìçAn Armenian government official indicates at least 55 Armenian prisoners are still in Azerbaijan‚Äôs custody, despite Baku‚Äôs claim to only have 23. üìçArmenia will be able to involve international law enforcement officers in investigations against Azerbaijan due to adoption of the International Criminal Court‚Äôs Rome Statute. üìçExploring Armenianess with Raffi Niziblian. media:group.media:title: Rewriting The Armenian Story
media:group.media:description:
In this Civilnet podcast, host Patrick Elliott sits down with guest Raffi Niziblian, repat and founder of DEEM Communications to discuss what it means to be Armenian, and what the vision for the future of Armenianness means both within Armenia and abroad.
